title: Valentine single-page proposal with evasive No and meme reveal

requirements.summary: Single romantic-themed page addressed to Aqsa Kousar with exactly two options: Yes and No
acceptanceCriteria: The main prompt text includes “Will you be my Valentine?” in English.
The name “Aqsa Kousar” appears on the page in a romantic context (e.g., greeting/header).
Only two primary action buttons are present: “Yes” and “No”.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine UI containing romantic header text for “Aqsa Kousar”, the prompt “Will you be my Valentine?”, and exactly two primary action buttons (“Yes” and “No”). Use the shadcn-ui Button component (from the existing UI library) to render consistent primary actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure document metadata stays minimal and aligned to a single-purpose Valentine page (keep English title; no additional sections/pages introduced).

requirements.summary: Evasive No button that moves away on hover (desktop) and touch interaction (iPad) and can never confirm No
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor over the “No” button causes it to reposition away from the pointer.
On touch devices (iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to reposition before a click/tap can be completed.
The “No” button never triggers a “No” selected state or confirmation UI.

file_operations.description: Implement evasive behavior for the “No” button: position it within a bounded container and randomly/strategically reposition it on mouse hover and on touch/pointer-down/touch-start so it becomes effectively not clickable; do not implement any “No selected” state or confirmation UI. If using the shadcn-ui Button component for “No”, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: On Yes click, transition to a confirmation state that reveals the Good choice meme image and removes/locks the choice UI
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image visibly contains the words “Good choice” (as part of the image).
After “Yes” is clicked, the Yes/No choice UI is no longer actionable (buttons removed or disabled).

file_operations.description: Add a “Yes selected” state that transitions the UI to show the static meme image and a clear confirmation view; hide or disable the Yes/No buttons after selection so the choice UI is no longer actionable. If using shadcn-ui components for buttons/layout elements, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Romantic pink-and-white theme with responsive layout and working interactions on iPad Chrome
acceptanceCriteria: The primary palette is pink and white; the look and feel is clearly romantic-themed.
The page layout remains usable and visually coherent on an iPad-sized viewport in Chrome.
All interactions (evasive No, Yes reveal) work without requiring page reloads.

file_operations.description: Define global styling (using existing Tailwind entrypoint conventions) for a pink-and-white romantic theme (background, typography defaults, button emphasis) while keeping the app single-page and responsive.

Apply responsive layout and spacing suitable for iPad Chrome (centered content, safe tap targets, bounded area for evasive No), ensuring interactions occur client-side without reloads. If leveraging shadcn-ui primitives for visual consistency, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated meme image as a static asset and load it directly from the frontend on Yes
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The app references the image via a static path and displays it on “Yes”.
No backend endpoints are added for image delivery.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x900.png.

Reference and render the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x900.png in the “Yes” confirmation state (frontend-only delivery; no backend involvement).
